CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Cade, hospital worker, Homewood, Miss Carroll Crawford, high school student, Homewood, and Miss Jennifer Norman, high school student, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 23, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you believe there is such a "social" classification as "Negro society?"  If so, on what do you believe it is based? Do you think such a basis is valid?"  Mr. Cade's answer reads: "I think there is and it's made up of persons who are well-educated and able to move into good positions." Ms. Crawford's answer reads: "...There is, and it's based on education, and I think that's a good basis."  Ms. Norman's answer reads: "...I think there is and it's based on prestige and education.  I think this is a good basis."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Robert Cade wearing dark cowl neck sweater, standing in front of light colored column; Group portrait of Carroll Crawford and Jennifer Norman, standing in front of car and church with arched entryway
